alert.note: Alert for Amelia; Brunswick; Dinwiddie; Eastern Chesterfield (Including Col. Heights); Nottoway; Powhatan; Sussex; Western Chesterfield; Western Henrico (Including the City of Richmond) (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 12 at 7:32PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT CHESTERFIELD...EASTERN NOTTOWAY...WEST CENTRAL SUSSEX...DINWIDDIE...AMELIA...SOUTHERN POWHATAN AND NORTHERN BRUNSWICK COUNTIES AND THE CITY OF RICHMOND THROUGH 830 PM EDT... At 732 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Macon to near Spainville to near Dundas. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph, heavy rain, and frequent lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small trees and blow around unsecured objects. Wind impacting handling of high profile vehicles. Reduced visibility and minor flooding possible. Frequent cloud to ground lightning strikes. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Mannboro around 740 PM EDT. Moseley around 745 PM EDT. McKenney around 750 PM EDT. Dewitt around 800 PM EDT. Dinwiddie, Bon Air, and Sutherland around 805 PM EDT. Matoaca and Chesterfield Court House around 810 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include North Wellville, Addison, Earls, Ammon, Pilkinton, Forkland, Wharfs Store, Darvills, Winterham, and Pocahontas State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Amelia; Brunswick; Dinwiddie; Eastern Chesterfield (Including Col. Heights); Nottoway; Powhatan; Sussex; Western Chesterfield; Western Henrico (Including the City of Richmond)
